items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Tamar, River Strat, River Neet, River Ottery, River Kensey

items.message: Flooding is possible on Tuesday the 16th in the evening and Wednesday the 17th in the morning. Heavy rain is expected overnight with the Upper River Tamar expected to peak around 4 am on Wednesday morning. Levels within rivers Neet and Strat are expected to rise also, but to a lesser extent. Expected levels suggest that there will be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river.  We expect the river to remain high throughout Wednesday, though no flooding to properties is currently forecast.  Take care and monitor your local weather conditions.  We are monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages. This message will be updated on Wednesday afternoon or earlier if the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Barle, River Exe, River Lyn, River Mole, River Bray

items.message: Flooding is possible on Tuesday the 16th in the evening and Wednesday the 17th in the morning. Heavy rain is expected overnight over Exmoor. The heaviest rain will be around 2am through to 6am, Wednesday morning. We expect river levels to remain high throughout Wednesday, though no flooding to properties is currently forecast. Take care and monitor your local weather conditions. We are constantly monitoring river levels. This message will be updated on Wednesday afternoon or earlier if the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Duddon, River Crake, Mill Beck

items.message:
Due to recent heavy rainfall, river levels are rising this morning, 17/09/2025, and may lead to flooding.
Areas most at risk include Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck and other watercourses, from Coniston to Barrow-in-Furness including low lying areas around Ulpha, Duddon Bridge, Broughton in Furness, Kirkby-in-Furness, Dalton in Furness and Ulverston.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 5:00 PM on 17/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Lancashire, North Yorkshire, Westmorland and Furness

items.message:
High River levels this morning, 17/09/2025, may lead to flooding. 
Areas most at risk include Rivers Kent and Bela and other watercourses, from Kentmere to Silverdale including low lying areas around Staveley, Burneside, Kendal, Milnthorpe and Beetham.
Rainfall is forecast to continue this morning. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated by 05:00 PM on 17/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message:
Rainfall overnight has caused rising river and lake levels which may lead to flooding of land and road. 

Areas most at risk include Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster and other watercourses, from Grasmere to Grange-over-Sands including low lying areas around Ambleside, Skelwith Bridge, Windermere, Hawkshead, Newby Bridge, Backbarrow, Cark and Cartmel.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 05:00 PM on 17/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around The Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water.
Further flooding is possible this morning (17/09/2025) as river and lake levels are remaining high due to heavy rainfall.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 05:00 PM on 17/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Barnstaple, Braunton, Ilfracombe and Combe Martin area
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Caen, Bradiford Water, River Yeo

items.message: Flooding is possible from the evening of Tuesday 16th September into the morning of Wednesday 17th. Heavy rainfall is expected overnight in the Barnstaple, Braunton, Ilfracombe and Combe Martin area. We expect river levels to remain high throughout Wednesday, though no flooding to properties is currently forecast. Take care and monitor your local weather conditions. We are constantly monitoring river levels. This message will be updated on Wednesday afternoon or earlier if the situation changes.

High river and lake levels are causing flooding this morning, 17/09/2025.

Areas most at risk include low lying areas bordering the shores of Derwent Water and the frontage of the Keswick Camping and Caravan Club Site .

Further showers are forecast this morning. We will continue to monitor rainfall, river, and lake levels. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water, and avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.

This message will be updated by 05:00 PM on 17/09/2025, or as the situation changes.
